best_practices: Validate PDF files before processing and handle encryption errors
Use the right library for each task (pdfplumber for tables, reportlab for creation)
Process large PDFs in chunks with garbage collection to manage memory
anti_patterns: Attempting to process encrypted PDFs without checking for passwords
Using basic text extraction on scanned documents without OCR
Skipping error handling when processing multiple PDF files

faq.question: Which Python library should I use for basic PDF operations?
faq.answer: Use pypdf for simple tasks like merge, split, rotate. Use pdfplumber for text and table extraction.

faq.question: How do I extract tables from scanned PDFs?
faq.answer: First perform OCR using pytesseract, then use pdfplumber to extract table structure from the OCR output.

faq.question: Can I create PDFs from scratch?
faq.answer: Yes, use reportlab library to programmatically create PDFs with text, images, tables, and formatted content.

faq.question: How do I handle password-protected PDFs?
faq.answer: Use pypdf PdfReader with user_password parameter. Check if encryption exists before processing.

faq.question: What formats can I convert PDFs to?
faq.answer: Use pdf2image to convert PDF pages to images (PNG, JPEG). Extract text to plain text or structured formats.

faq.question: How do I extract metadata from PDFs?
faq.answer: Use pypdf PdfReader to access document metadata including author, title, creation date, and custom keywords.
